description: From Middle English local, from Late Latin locālis (“belonging to a place”), possibly also via Old French local; ultimately from Latin locus (“a place”).

adjectives.description: local (comparative more local, superlative most local)

entries.meaning: From or in a nearby location.
examples: We prefer local produce.

entries.meaning: (computing, of a resource) Connected directly to a particular computer, processor, etc.; able to be accessed offline.
examples: local disk drive
local file
The panel shows both local and remote sites.
Antonym: remote

entries.meaning: (computing, of a variable or identifier) Having limited scope (either lexical or dynamic); only being accessible within a certain portion of a program.
examples: Antonym: global

entries.meaning: (mathematics, not comparable, of a condition or state) Applying to each point in a space rather than the space as a whole.
(medicine) Of or pertaining to a restricted part of an organism.
examples: local lesion
The patient didn't want to be sedated, so we applied only local anesthesia.
Synonym: topical
Hawaiian Pidgin is spoken by the local population.

adverbs.description: local (comparative more local, superlative most local)

entries.meaning: In the local area; within a city, state, country, etc.
examples: It's never been more important to buy local.

entries.meaning: A person who lives near a given place.
examples: It's easy to tell the locals from the tourists.

entries.meaning: A branch of a nationwide organization such as a trade union.
examples: I'm in the TWU, too. Local 6.
The expresses skipped my station, so I had to take a local.
Synonym: stopper
Antonyms: fast, express

entries.meaning: (Britain) One's nearest or regularly frequented public house or bar.
examples: I got barred from my local, so I've started going all the way into town for a drink.
Functional programming languages usually don't allow changing the immediate value of locals once they've been initialized, unless they're explicitly marked as being mutable.

entries.meaning: (US, slang, journalism) An item of news relating to the place where the newspaper is published.
(finance) An independent trader who acts for themselves rather than on behalf of investors.
examples: Synonym: floor trader

entries.meaning: (fandom slang, derogatory) A Twitter user who is not a part of Stan Twitter.
examples: Her camera roll is filled with pictures and videos of her idol, she doesn't let any of her friends see her account because "no locals allowed",  […]
